content.description: Start sitting in the hole, with an incut undercling for the left and a juggy sidepull on the arete for the right.  Climb the face through sustained climbing and some tricky moves.
content.protection: 3/4 pads and a spot.  You could take a boulder to the back if you aren’t careful.
content.location: Just on top of Halo and 20 feet north of Archangel.

content.description:
Start standing on good holds in the horizontal break. Pull the small roof and work right to top out.

 A sit start was also done, which probably adds two or three grades and subtracts two or three stars.
content.location: About 50 ft uphill from the dumpster boulder and a little south through the trees. The problem faces south.

content.description: Fun boulder! Sit start with a right underling and left hand on a gaston, do a couple moves and top out. A knee bar pad may help you out on this one...
content.location: Right side of the ripple boulder on the steep compression feature

content.description: Starts sitting on jugs, climbs out a mini roof on quality holds and movement. Crux is moving to the lip, landing is a little weird and you definitely want to pad the rock to the left for the top.null
content.location: This boulder is directly on top of archangel. Easiest way to get to it is by walking up the right of the cliffband and dropping down to it.

content.description: One of the best in Wisconsin; A five star boulder anywhere. Heaven's Gate is a long power endurance boulder that follows a natural traverse line climbing most of the boulder(Should be noted that there's possibility for a direct top out variation although it may be more contrived, harder, and definitely more dangerous than this line). There is no super defined crux, but the move to the last good hold before you top out has some difficulty and a fall from this position would be quite dangerous. Starts on a large rail low and to the right.
content.protection: 6 pads 2 spotters? A large blubber pad would be a huge help to protect the top of this thing
content.location: This is the south facing wall on the large free standing boulder in the Heavenly Boulders area

content.description: Start sitting on the rock, squeezing the obvious feature.  Squeeze your way up and top out.  A good spotter is key.
content.protection: More pads is better.  There are possibilities for a bad fall.  Definitely a spotter.
content.location: Lowest left corner of the prominent talus field above the Dumpster Boulder.  The problem faces downhill.

content.description: Logical linkup between Heaven's gate and the top of Eternal Punishment. Start in the same position as Heaven's Gate and climb straight up and traverse to the right to the jugs on Eternal Punishment. Continue topping out like on Eternal Punishment. Fun moves, not nearly as good as either of the original lines but worth doing if in the area.

One of the best at the lake; classic anywhere. Sit starts on an obvious juggy rail. Crux is the first two moves, where you likely are going to do a big move to a crimp and then jump to a jug. From here the difficulty eases up but the landing isn't great and its not easy to pad. Originally done topping out straight up above the start but the far more natural line is traversing right as soon as you can at the top(topping out direct doesn't change difficulty but topping out this way makes it an X).
content.location: On the "Heaven's Gate" boulder facing the lake. In between Heaven's Gate and Blind Faith

content.description: Sit start on a large underling jug, grab an edge, and do a big move to a good hold. From the good hold is excellent V0 climbing to a big ledge you can escape and stand onto. Up to this point is a V2, but continuing straight up from the ledge adds a grade and puts you high off the ground in a no fall zone. The top is super fun but the added difficulty and height make it for the non faint of heart. Do whatever gets you psyched, this is an excellent climb.
content.protection: 3 pads? Don't fall on the top
content.location: Face to the right of archangel; this climb faces the lake

content.description: Start sitting, left hand low on a ledge with a pocket on the left side, and right on the arete on a spot with a little edge.  Smack up the arete, and once you are standing up it is pretty much done.  It has been topped out various ways.  If you start with a left sidepull a couple moves in it’s probably a grade easier.
content.location: On large boulder just below and next to Archangel and Ripple Roof.

climbs.name: Archangel
climbs.fa: Ian CB and Eric Cashman probably

content.description: A real gem, likely one of the best for the grade around.  From a stand climb the shield like face and double arete feature. The top is a bit committing but it does pad up well.
content.location: Just in the trees left of the prominent talus field that is just above the Dumpster Boulder.  About 50 feet higher than the dumpster boulder.   This faces northeast.

content.description: Starting low on the right side of the roof on edges next to each other, pull on and move leftward through slopes, pinches, and and edge or two.  Top out left of the ferns, and it is a little tricky.  The first few moves are dabby, but the holds and movement is very good..
content.location: 50 feet south of the main Heaven Boulders cluster that contains Archangel, just uphill from a pillar, the roof faces south.  Named after the graffiti on the boulder.  Possibly one of the first problems in the area.

content.description:
South and up the slope from the Dumpster Boulder this rock is named for the peace symbol painted on it.  

 Hike along tumbled rocks trail until you get to the Pete's Pebble talus field.  Walk up the southern edge of this talus 200 yards and these boulders will be on your left.
